context_blocks.content: 8 legacy systems in decommission queue across 6-week schedule. Weeks 1-2: Typeset. Weeks 2-3: CREOP. Weeks 2-4: Smartsheet, Pipedrive. Weeks 3-4: MarketingBlocks, Loveable. Weeks 4-6: Canva. Weeks 5-6: Adobe CC (evaluation). Priority order: Pipedrive/Smartsheet/CREOP first, Adobe/Loveable evaluation extends later.

Data actions per system: Pipedrive — export contacts, deals, activities → import to Dynamics 365. CREOP — export deal data, documents, NDA records → Wix Deal Room. Smartsheet — export all sheets as XLSX → import to SharePoint. MarketingBlocks — export templates, replace with GPT agents. Typeset — export all documents to SharePoint. Canva — export brand assets to SharePoint. Adobe CC — audit licenses, archive project files. Loveable — export code to GitHub, archive design files to SharePoint.

3-phase decommission checklist: Phase 1 (Data Export) — export all user data, transaction history, documents, config settings, verify completeness. Phase 2 (Import & Validation) — import to target, map fields, validate record counts, test workflows, UAT. Phase 3 (Retirement) — notify users, update documentation, cancel subscription, archive final backup, remove from password manager.

Estimated annual savings from consolidation: $4,000-$8,000+/year from retiring Pipedrive, CREOP, Smartsheet, MarketingBlocks, Typeset, Canva Pro, and partial Adobe reduction. Additional benefits: reduced complexity, fewer login credentials, unified audit trail, single support channel.

decisions.decision: Retire 6 legacy systems, evaluate 2 more over 6-week staged schedule
decisions.rationale: Eliminate redundancy, consolidate into core Microsoft + Wix + AI stack

decisions.decision: All data archived to SharePoint before any system retirement
decisions.rationale: Ensure zero data loss during migration; SharePoint provides audit trail and version control
decisions.impact: Every decommissioned system's data is preserved and accessible

decisions.decision: Staged wave approach for decommission (not all-at-once)
decisions.rationale: Minimize operational disruption; allow validation between waves
decisions.impact: Team can adapt to changes incrementally
